. It existed since the Dacian times, and ruines are still left to be seen. It was the site of the court of Basarab I, a very important ruler in Muntenia. It is also the place of the Monastery Curtea de Arges, built by Neagoe Basarab, another main leader, in the 16th century.
Curtea de Arges is about 20 km north from Pitesti.

value: The old royal court and monastery is the former seat of the "King" of Romania. These originate from the 13th and 16th century. Located on Str. Negru Voda, nr.2, open from 8 to 18 in summer.
The house of the painter Dumitru Norocea. Located on Str. Stefanescu Victor, nr.8,open every day, except monday from 9 to 17.
Municipal Museum, features ethnography and history. Located on Str. Negru Voda Nr.2, open every day, except monday from 9 to 16.
can be reached by the scenic Transfagarasan mountain road.
